145                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 i have a similar technique for phone screen . candidate are told to do the interview where they can receive email . to avoid cheating , we send them a couple of code snippet right a we call them . then , we talk about the code.we found that phone screener have a bias toward those who speak well , so we often brought in terrible programmer for a half day of interview . what a waste , especially when flying people in . the in-person failure we experienced were of the fizzbuzz variety , not the `` i do n't exactly under stand concurrency '' sort.so , we started asking people to read some code and comment on it . really basic java stuff : will this code compile ? trace the flow of execution through this method if the blahexception wa thrown . string comparison with == . the idea wa to see if ( 1 ) the person wa at all clueful , and ( 2 ) if they had actually written java code . a the linked blogger noted , the disparity in response is shocking . we found that about half the people we interviewed thought that execution of a java method ceased once a catch block had been entered . half ! how could they ever have written robust production code ? these were often people with year of java experience on their resume . i just do n't understand how someone could write a bunch of java code and not understand the basic of how exception work.some other part of the code review were more nuanced . most candidate knew that one should not compare string using double equal , but they usually could n't explain why . nor did they understand why == sometimes seems to work when comparing a referenced string object to a literal . we were happy to hire smart candidate that had n't done a lot of java work , but we wanted to avoid people who had supposedly spent year with a language and did n't even comprehend the basic .
146                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     i think this depends on what you are looking for in a candidate . being able to read code is good , but if you want to hire someone who is really good now and will be 10x better in 6-12 month , you do n't want someone who is opinionated and arrogant about what constitutes good code . you 'll want someone who recognizes something doe n't look right and then asks why it wa n't done a better way .
147                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       this seems too small and specific to matter . sure , it is important to manage what is going on inside a loop iterating a million time . but without a good profiling system to know where to work , this could be wasted effort . and good design of a large system will matter more than any single function or loop.that said , you could do a high level system design and get down into a few detail .
148                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      national instrument ( austin , tx ) used to do that alot and it worked great . they start with some code critique and then slowly , starting with `` how would you re-write this from scratch ? '' they get you to write some , following by popular `` optimize for speed/memory '' and so on.i just recently had somewhat similar idea : to reverse table and ask them to interview me . not the typical `` how do you like it here ? '' kind , but i want to ask people to ask me technical question and see what they can come up with .
149                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 i 've had a lot of interview and never had to do a code critique . microsoft 's had me write some simple reverse string type thing but never critique code . it would think it would work great . being able to turn some junk into something elegant and functional is a way better skill ( for an employer wanting experienced programmer ) than knowing the term and name of methodology you learn in school .
150                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              nice article , but drastically oversimplified . paul ignores two critical issue : risk , and non-linear utility-of-money function . these two factor become critical when there is a tradeoff between probability of success and the payoff of success.suppose , a a simple example , that i have a startup which i think ha a 50 % chance of succeeding and being sold for $ 1m , and a 50 % chance of failing and being worthless . now suppose that paul selects me to participate in yc , but want 10 % of the company , and i think his help will leave the potential valuation unchanged but increase the chance of success from 50 % to 55 % . if i accept his offer , my expected return drop from $ 500k ( 50 % of $ 1m ) to $ 495k ( 55 % of $ 900k ) -- but i 'd still accept the offer , because increasing my chance of getting that first $ 900k is worth far more than getting an additional $ 100k on top of that.on the other hand , suppose a venture capital company come along and offer to help me expand into a much larger market , where i 'd have a 10 % chance of the company being worth $ 100m ( and a 90 % chance of the company being worthless ) , in exchange for taking 50 % of the company stock . if i accept the offer , my expected return jump from $ 500k to $ 5m ( 10 % of $ 50m ) -- but there 's no way that i 'd accept the offer , because i really do n't want to spend year of my life on something which ha a 90 % chance of being worthless.it 's important to understand the number , but in the end the number , at best , have to guide you rather than making decision for you .
151                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              paul - this is seth levine ( quoted in the usa today article referenced and appropriately called out in your post ) . let me set the record straight . while i 've seen plenty of article come to press that ha somewhat inaccurate quote , this wa the first time i 've been completely misrepresented in an article . i 've written a full post on my view here - http : //sethlevine.typepad.com/vc_adventure/2007/07/setting-t .... it 's particularly frustrating in this case , a i 've spent literally hundred of hour working with techstars and techstars company in boulder this summer ( and am the lead mentor to one very promising project ) . i actually believe strongly in the model.i hope you 'll consider posting this response up to your main site with a reference to my post clarifying my views.seth levine
152                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        the article ignores how market price work - the formula presented let you know the maximum equity you can give up and still get a positive return by doing so , but incorrectly explains why vcs accept much le - the minimum equity a vc can accept and still expect a positive return on their investment can be far lower than the maximum the startup can afford to give profitably . the vcs are subject to competition with other vcs , so in such case they can not force the startup to accept a just-better-than-breakeven deal .
153                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      even in a simple model , time should be incorporated , right ? the total cost for the life of the company of an employee is included , assuming a particular growth rate . what about for investment ? `` the total cost of this round of funding '' doe n't make sense so much . and surely the rate of increased value of your company matters.also , it seems , like you note in the end , that there is still a gut feeling , and here it is stated simply : how can you predict how much your company will grow because of an investment ? this is easier if you have sale number that show some trend , where investing $ n in business development yield x more user leading to y more profit . if you 're reddit , and you have n't even monetized your user before being purchased , this can be harder . also organic growth implies le direct business development.one simple question that i think ha a standard/gaap answer : how much is your company worth if you are making $ x yearly and growing at a rate of y % ? i vaguely recall term like `` good-will estimate '' and `` present value of future money '' in the single management class i 've taken year ago . but is there something standard for a company going through valuation for acquisition or taking a next round of funding . [ ignore for the moment that a company making a nice profit and growing ideally would n't need a next round of funding . ]
154                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       from my perspective it 's partically an emotional path , not merely an analytical path . a company that 's a startup ha an intention , and it 's one of these:1. you use resource to incrementally grow a user base and get market share , then sell it off to a bigger company2 . you develop technology that enhances a company 's market share and pull user from a competitive company 's market3 . you lose , and the investor loses a small amount of money the bottom line for me is that the value of your start-up is based on the number of user you can get . it 's about your intention x with the assistence of your investor will find the user and people you need . whether it 's a good deal or not is irrelevant if those are not true - take the journey.whether it 's a mobius or another vc , for me a an entrepreneur , they have not established a community tool to have access to a community that will help grow the start-up quickly . you 're not just buying equity in the equation x you 're buying into the community 's collaboration . the equity value is not just based on `` here 's some money for x cent on the dollar '' x it ha to go beyond that .
155                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        i personally would n't do anything but 50/50 . even if it is 49.9/50.1 you are saying that the person with the higher % is inherently better , and this can leak into the dynamic of the startup in so many way . lawyer like to point out thing like this , but they are n't the entrepreneurs.i can tell you from experience that if you have the right co-founder , 50/50 is no problem . if there is a disagreement , however minor , you talk it out until one person convinces the other . this pretty much never happened in my case , by the way .
156                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            i know another startup that wa faced with a similar issue ( they have since been acquired , proving that this doe , indeed , work ) -- they decided to split it 49.9/50.1 with the person who thought of the idea first getting the majority.naturally if you have thousand of share , just take one from the person who 's going to get le equity and give it to yourself ( assuming all share have equal voting right ) . another alternative is to split the equity 50/50 , but have the voting right divided differently . this is a pain in the as because you have to insert a bunch of ( extra ) legal mumbo jumbo in the operating agreement for tax purposes.a potential problem is if you both sort of thought of the idea together ( i.e . it wa an iterative process ) . well , then , if you are adamant about a 50/50 split , you can always resort to third ( neutral ) party arbitration if a dispute should arise , but this is a pain.i would do it 49.9/50.1 -- -one of you must have started this entire process .
157                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         i 've had 2 and three person partnership ... one person tends to grab the thought-leadership and the others tend to follow ( tho hopefully not so much that they do n't speak up with great idea ) .i would advise having a buy-sell agreement that allows a graceful exit if one person want out , but otherwise i 'd agree that partner selection is 50 % of the battle ( and letting go of your own ego is the other 50 % ) .for buy sell agreement , the best i 've seen , simply stated , is this : at any time , partner a can make an offer to buy partner b 's stake for value x ( whatever they want to offer ) . the rub is that partner b can decide to reverse the offer ( buying partner a 's stake for value x ) and partner a is obliged to sell.hopefully you 'll never need such an agreement , but it suck to feel trapped in a business ( or trapped with a partner who ha turned into a lunatic or is no longer pulling his weight ) .so far , every partnership i 've had ha been an even one , and i 've never had to exercise an buy-sell clause like that ( knock on wood ! ) .

175                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     well , server optimization ha been my primary hobby for the past month , and i 'd like to make some clarification about a few thing the article says.saying that lighttpd support `` cgi script , ruby on rail , pylon , turbogears , django , quixote , webpy , mongrel , catalyst , mason , joomla , awstats , and so much more '' is kind of misleading . lighttpd can do a few thing : it doe fast cgi ( fcgi support explains about 75 % of the example in that list ) , it can serve static file , and it can proxy request to other server . lighttpd doe n't `` support mongrel '' , because mongrel is another server . what lighttpd doe is use something akin to mod_proxy to send certain request somewhere else , that somewhere else might be a mongrel cluster that is running on port 8080 ( hence it `` support '' mongrel ) . that proxying service is where the majority of lighttpd usage ha been . a typical efficient setup these day ( youtube doe along these line ) is to have lighttpd accept incoming request and if the request is for a static file then it serf the request ( because it is very lightweight ( i.e . minimal ) it is more efficient than apache at serving static medium ) , and if it is for dynamic content the request is passed to apache , which then pass it back to lighttpd , which pass it back to the requester ( this mean that `` heavy '' apache thread will be dedicated to a request for a shorter period of time since it only ha to communicate/wait for lighttpd instead of the actual requester ) . lighttpd on it own is n't necessarily the best solution ( an example from my experience is that mod_python and apache become more efficient at serving dynamic content than fcgi and lighttpd a the number of requester per second get very high ) . usually a combination of a light frontend server and apache in the backend can provide the best performance ( again this is at high number , at lower number lighttpd is probablly equally or more efficient ) . a a final note , i 'd really recommend nginx over lighttpd if you are looking for a light http server to serve static content , support fcgi , and/or proxy to other server . the biggest reason ? lighttpd leak memory and ha to be restarted occasionally because every couple of day ( under heavy usage ) it dy . not a great feature in a production server .
176                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    the big win of lighttpd/nginx is that they 're single-process [ 1 ] multiplexing server . apache spawn dozen ( or hundred ) of processes/threads and relies on the o to distribute resource . this critical difference is why they 're so much more efficient and generally faster . the epoll mechanism in linux ha widened the gap even further.brad fitzpatrick created a software load balancer in perl that handle all the request for livejournal based on this principle . [ 2 ] 1. a small number of process may be used to take advantage of multi-processor machines.2 . http : //danga.com/perlbal/
177                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            the `` rise '' of lighttpd ? i think it 's dying now . apache 2.2 and nginx are the king of the hill .
178                                            there used to be an option to export to csv . look like they got rid of it . the fact that they are actually removing functionality say something . a couple year ago i exported all my facebook contact into a mind map using freemind . i then sorted all of my friend according to where i met them . so for example , a possible node location would be college - & # 62 ; class - & # 62 ; cs100 - & # 62 ; john . then if a person had introduced me to more people , those new people would fall under that person . not only wa it useful a a visual rolodex , but it wa also useful for visualizing which people and organization were the most socially productive for me .

job that 's done every night . it would look to facebook almost like the kind of activity i 've seen from several user , clicking through all their friend to look at picture , wall post , and other crap.i 'm not saying that the current setup is optimal ; i 'm just saying that backup are certainly not impossible .

200                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              pull quote : '' the reason we built these apps wa , in retrospect , incredibly shallow , and i thank my ex-boss for helping me realise this . we built them because we thought they were going to be popular , following the typical web 2.0 path to rich : 1. make popular app . 2 . ? ? ? 3 . profit ! ! 1 '' looking back , i think to myself , is trying to make a popular app enough anymore ? if you just attempt to make a popular app , how are you any different from the next web startup . the only thing that separate you is ability , and ability can be hired or learned - so the question becomes who ha deeper pocket or more free time . thusly any idiot with time or money can build a web app these day and these were crowded market we were attempting to break into - productivity and mobile blogging . what then , separate the wheat from the chaff in this case ? for me , i think the big one is emotional investment . ''
201                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        interesting comment from everyone . a couple i would like to address . `` god damn , that guy ha a lot of picture of himself in that article '' yes , yes i do . read my blog and you 'll discover that i 'm a total narcissist . it 's all part of the blog theme . `` is this really true , when you take into account startup that fight tooth and nail and still do n't succeed ? is it better to start with the confidence , money , and connection of other people and then ride the wave of their support , or is it better to start with nothing other than your own belief in yourself and then fight tooth and nail until you get the confidence , money , and connection of others ? `` good point . my point then is that you need all of the above . if you have connection , capital and a good idea - then sorry , you 're a carbon copy of thousand of other tech entrepreneur . what separate you from them ? anyone can always get more capital if you poke around a bit . anyone can get more connection if you spend more time schmoozing . what you ca n't simply `` get '' is an emotional attachment to whatever you are doing . that 's something that ha to be there from the beginning , i think . that is what i learned from this experience . `` problem 1 : trying to build 3 apps while doing consulting work ( no focus ) '' definitely . i absolutely agree . however , we were in no position to argue ( much ) and a i said in the post , the relationship we had with the supposed investor wa flawed . `` problem 2 : the author wa a dick to his only employee ( wtf ? why ? ) '' ken wa n't an employee . he wa being paid the same a me and provided similar function , although i naturally took on more of a leadership role , being the more experienced . i 'm a dick anyway , but yes , i wa hard on ken because i expected him to help me a much a possible not to fuck up the opportunity i thought we had . but when you are ready to launch and you find that there are lot of basic error in the html or front end code because advice you 've given over and over ha n't been taken in , it 's hard to remain cool and collected , especially if it 's with a mate.if anything , being in that situation taught me that i am not fit to be a bos and not fit to team lead . i am much better working alone , and my individual work speaks for itself . that is why i am now leaning towards solo consulting a the focus of my career .
202                                                                                                                             it wa n't even a startup at all . they were lying to themselves that it wa . in effect they were employee of an investment firm in some sort of ill-defined incubation weirdness . everyone involved wa pretty clueless about what wa going on and what to expect . the investment firm wa rolling the dice and these guy were enjoying the learning experience and break from consulting .
203                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  a bunch of quote in this article stuck out at me , but this one in particular : '' how can you possibly have the emotional investment necessary to see thing through to profitability , through high , low and everything in between , if you have n't fought tooth and nail to get there ? `` is this really true , when you take into account startup that fight tooth and nail and still do n't succeed ? is it better to start with the confidence , money , and connection of other people and then ride the wave of their support , or is it better to start with nothing other than your own belief in yourself and then fight tooth and nail until you get the confidence , money , and connection of others ? my bos is trying to convince me that i should at least have an offer of cash in hand from an angel investor before leaving my day job , even if i choose not to take it . while this is quite self-serving ( he doe n't want me to leave ) , it also sound pretty rational . i mean , right now i have fairly little validation other than my cofounder 's confidence , my desire to use our own product , and my belief that i have the technical chop to get to the point where we can.the article suggests that it 's probably better not to have that external validation , and definitely better not to take the money . is that character-building , or foolhardy ?

210                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         i think vesting is a good idea for the founder ( it 's in their best interest ) , but i think if you 're asking for someone to commit to such a long time period ( ie 4-5 year ) , then it better be really good equity . even better than if it were just offered `` up front . '' there are also opportunity cost to consider , so your early employee or co-founders could be off starting their own company with a lot more equity . so it 's probably going to vary by each person , but in my experience , the vested equity ha to be really good or i 'm not interested.i 've been in startup where the vested equity wa really low , and i left ( i wa employee # 1 ) . i 've also talked with numerous people who thought about joining the same startup , and refused due to a number of reason , but low equity wa mentioned a one of the first reason .

213 220                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      i have a bit of a conflict of interest on this topic , being a developer for a window manager , but i also have some rarely expressed opinion because of that point of view . so , keep that in mind when reading my comment below.this is an idea i 've heard before . i agree that everything in the world is going to the web . file system will become distributed . every application you use will come from the internet , with the exception of your kernel and the software needed to retrieve the application . they 'll probably run remotely , too , and just send you the graphics/ui.however , i think that turning the web browser into a window manager is going in the wrong direction . it completely disobeys the unix philosophy of writing program that do one thing well . firefox 's role in the future should be rendering and running remote application . organizing the apps using tab , mdi , window , workspace , viewports , etc . should be left to the people who are spending all of their time thinking about how to organize application .
221                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             i think when you say `` firefox o '' you really mean `` browser-based ui for linux , '' right ? you are already supposing that linux ( an actual operating system ) exists underneath.is n't internet explorer + window explorer + web folder pretty much doing this already ? window ' web folder feature let you store document remotely and access them over http from regular ( non-web-enabled ) application . internet explorer let you browse the local filesystem and the web from the same browser window pretty seamlessly.it seems that firefox is indeed becoming an application deployment platform . however , it doe n't seem like a good idea to me . instead of having one package manager in the operating system , there will be two : one system package manage and one firefox package manager . there are all kind of security and manageability problem with that . already , there are many buggy firefox plugins that cripple the browser , effectively causing a do attack with crash and decreased performance . this is a good indication that we should not have confidence in firefox 's ability to manage third party application . really firefox should be in that business at all , since resource allocation and crash prevention are fundamentally operating system feature . the right solution is to improve the installation experience provided by the operating system , and have it provide security-oriented integration capability for application ( a opposed to to the performance-oriented integration capability we have now ) . this would require the operating system to provide a sandboxed environment by default to downloaded application . the o need to provide a middle ground between the almost unrestricted access given to today 's downloaded application , and the totally restricted access given to web apps ; that access need to be very close to the web app side.with this kind of severely-limited sandbox , we can then eliminate the whole ui of application installation . instead of installation , we would just have caching . instead of a list of program in `` add/remove program , '' we would just have a `` free up xxx mb of disk space '' page .
222                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            yes , this is a great idea . i do n't use much more than a web browser , though firefox 2.0 really get bogged down with complex flash and javascript . the rendering engine of firefox 3.0 is much better in that sense.i 've thought about this in great detail . the essential point is that a pure firefox gui allows someone uncomfortable with a normal computer to accomplish amazing task . limiting the user interface allows them to accomplish more and there 's almost nothing that ca n't be done from firefox anyways . it 's an idea yc like , my team got an interview with this idea to get rejected for our lack of a prototype.for now , i 'm working on my biotech startup but once that 's bringing in revenue i 'm planning on coming back to this.email me , i 'd love to talk about this more .

need a browser for that for most application , but it is a convenient platform.but it ca n't be all web .

consistently down-modded into oblivion , essentially nullifying any chance for it to appear ? how will the yc startup handle the irate company ? i know an answer would be that they should change their advertisement , but still , some company may get angry at the yc startup that the money they payed for advertisement did n't do any good . how will they handle that situation ? i 'm guessing the advertisement are charged on a per-click base , but is there a base charge , or tiered pricing for size of initial random viewing of web-pages registered with the company ? if the yc startup ca n't fulfill a promise of at least some level of ad-viewer-ship , then why should a company have their ad go through them ?

up with on his own . `` ( see the lispnyc site for detail on the meeting : http : //lispnyc.org/home.clp )
